task.title: Setting up Anomaly Detection
task.shortdesc: Steps to select report suites, metrics, and training/view periods for anomaly detection.

context.p: You set up Anomaly Detection independently for each report suite. Filtered metrics you define for one report suite do not carry over to other report suites.

step.cmd: Navigate to Adobe Marketing Cloud > Analytics > Reports and Analytics > Site Metrics > Anomaly Detection.
Select the report suite for which you want to track daily anomaly detection. To display a list of report suites, click the Report Suite selector drop-down menu.
To select the metrics and/or define filtered metrics, click Edit Metrics at the top right of the screen: .
step.stepresult: You can pick metrics from the list (including calculated metrics) of all metrics, from a list of filtered metrics, or from a list of tracked metrics. You can also filter on specific terms to narrow down the list, and you can add filtered metrics. The Filtered Metrics feature in the Anomaly Detection tool is being replaced by the ability to apply segments in Anomaly Detection. You can apply a segment to the Anomaly Detection tool using the "Show Segments" button at the top of the report page. Filtered Metrics will be removed from this tool on October 16, 2014.

step.cmd: For example, to define filtered metrics for tracking page view anomalies on a specific page, click Add Filtered Metric:

chrow.chdesc: Create a unique name for the metric.
Select, for example, Page. The list now gets filtered to provide you with a list of valid elements.
Specify a page name or number. The list gets filtered further to provide you with a list of valid metrics.

step.stepresult: Click Add and you have your filtered metric.

step.cmd: Define the Training Period and the View Period for anomaly detection. (Think of the training period as the "learning period" for the algorithm.)
step.stepresult:
Keep in mind that:
The training period ends right before the view period starts.
The default for both is 30 days, and you can extend them to 60 or 90 days.
Extending the training period puts your data in a larger context and may reduce the size of an anomaly.
The Anomaly Detection metrics report refreshes every time you change a parameter. You can now start interpreting the report.

step.cmd: (Optional) Change the end date of the View Period. The default is yesterday.
